unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Whale Watching: A Statement on Probability
question_text: Captain Will's Whale Watching Adventures offers whale watching tours and boasts “the probability that a whale will be sighted on any particular one of our sailings is about $85\%$ ”. Assuming this statement to be true, what is the best way to interpret it?

choices.text: A whale will be sighted on 85 85 out of every 100 sailings 100 sailings at Captain Will's Whale Watching Adventures.
Over the course of  many, many sailings at Captain Will's Whale Watching Adventures, a whale will be sighted about 85 % 85 % of the time.
About 85 % 85 % of people who go whale watching will sight a whale.
About 85 % 85 % of people who go whale watching at Captain Will's Whale Watching Adventures will sight a whale.
85 85 out of every 100 people 100 people who sail with Captain Will's Whale Watching Adventures will sight a whale.
